newsitem.title: LATVIA: Latvian shares ease slightly in sluggish trade.
newsitem.headline: Latvian shares ease slightly in sluggish trade.

text.p: Latvia's market remained stuck in its summer rut on Wednesday and dealers said it would not pick up until a spate of six-month results comes out later this month.
Overall market volume was a sluggish 44,000 lats and the bourse index lost 0.59 points to 383.41. The Rietumu index slipped 0.02 percent to 152.07.
Riga Shipyard was the most active stock, inching up to 1.30 lats from 1.29 lats in trade of 15,400 lats.
Unibanka rose slightly to 3.35 lats from 3.34 in trade of 14,600 lats.
Dealers hope that Unibanka, one of the bourse's few blue chips, will post more gains and possibly keep other prices afloat.
The market has been hard hit by summer and competition from the local debt market and privatisation vouchers, which are regarded as better buys at the moment.

As in neighbouring Lithuania, local investors have been scared off by a long, painful correction which set in after a surge earlier in the year and the market still lacks enough big companies to catch the eye of foreign investors.
